parents.intro1: - " What did you do today at school?"

what_is.para1: As parents, that's a conversation we've all had with our child at one time or another.  We want to understand more about what they're learning, to play an active part in their education.  We want to be able to engage with them about their school work, to help support and motivate them. But itâ€™s not that easy.  It's hard to know how to do that, how to encourage them to share their education with you.
what_is.para3: It's a really simple, free service that lets your child's teacher send you questions you can ask your child about their schoolwork.  They can also give you some keywords to look out for in your conversation, some hints to help your conversation along, and even some web links for you to find out more about the subject yourself.  Our vision is for every parent to be able to have regular, rewarding conversations with their child about their education.  We think this is a great place to start.
what_is.para4: We are currently in a limited trial phase with selected schools.

how_work.para1: Once your child's school has signed up to SchoolTalk, their teacher will be able to send short questions to you by email or text message. To get started:
how_work.list2: select their year group or class
how_work.list3: simply enter your email address or mobile number to start receiving questions.

privacy.para1: SchoolTalk values the privacy of parents and children above all else.
privacy.para2: To use SchoolTalk.org.uk, schools, teachers and parents aren't required to enter any child's details. That means we don't collect or store any information about your child, or anyone else's.
privacy.para3: The questions you'll be sent are for a particular class or year group, they're not specific to your child.  Only questions provided by the school's teachers can be sent to parents.
